===Etymology===
From {{m|ja|大腹餅||big stomach [[mochi]] (“very filling mochi”)|tr=だいふくもち, daifuku mochi|sc=Jpan}}, by replacing {{m|ja|腹||[[stomach]]|tr=[[ふく]], [[fuku]]|sc=Jpan}} by homophone {{m|ja|福||[[luck]]|tr=[[ふく]], [[fuku]]|sc=Jpan}}.

Previously {{m|ja|腹太餅||stomach fat mochi|tr=はらぶともち, harabuto mochi (“very filling mochi”)|sc=Jpan}}.<ref>[http://www.narumi-mochi.jp/kaisetsu/daifuku.html]</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{ja-pron|だいふく|acc=4|acc_ref=NHK}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|だいふく}}

# [[daifuku]], a Japanese confection consisting of a [[mochi]] ([[glutinous rice]] cake) stuffed with {{m|ja|餡子||[[red bean paste]]|tr=あんこ, anko|sc=Jpan}}.
